rationale: The segment contains factual numbers, not an intensifier/comparative modifying a risk-adjective.
The segment reports factual findings ('were found to have') without high-potency verbs or metaphors.
The segment does not contain a loaded rhetorical question.
The segment reports negative facts (cases in mammals) and lacks explicit calming language.
Segment provides numbers and scale but lacks a minimiser token applied to the event's scope.
The segment does not contain a bare negation.
Reports findings in wild mammals ('14 out of 134 wild mammals... were found to have avian flu'), reporting on surveillance/detection findings without active reassurance.
